meanings.definition: Make legally null and void; invalidate.
meanings.sent1: The judge was nullifying the contract due to a mistake in the signature.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer nullified the will, as it was not properly executed.
meanings.sent3: The magician nullified the contract with a wave of his wand, making it disappear.
meanings.sent4: Her apology nullified the tension in the room, bringing peace to all.
meanings.sent5: The storm nullified all the progress we had made on the construction site.

meanings.sent1: Eating healthy food can help nullify the negative effects of stress on your body.
meanings.sent2: Drinking water can nullify the effects of dehydration on a hot day.
meanings.sent3: Exercising regularly can nullify the impact of a sedentary lifestyle.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude nullified the pessimism of her colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The medicine nullified the pain, allowing him to rest peacefully.

meanings.definition: Render of no value or effect.
meanings.sent1: The new evidence presented in court nullified the previous testimony.
meanings.sent2: The apology nullified the anger she felt towards him.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected compliment nullified her self-doubt, boosting her confidence.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise nullified the peaceful atmosphere of the library.
meanings.sent5: The cancellation of the event nullified all the preparations we had made.
